Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a flat bowl-like body, a slightly concave base with a groove, a short splayed nozzle and the stub of a vertical ring-handle. The discus is decorated with a six-petalled rosette in relief, in the centre of which is a filling-hole, and there are six subsidiary holes pierced between the petals. At the discus edge is a double cable-moulding within a plain moulded ring. Traces of a reddish slip remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q572)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs B C Shuckburgh
